dt: {bc}to treat or consider (a person or a group of people) as alien to oneself or one's group (as because of different racial, sexual, or cultural characteristics)

dt.t: … we trace how in small rural communities these processes of {wi}othering{/wi} the poor are racialized
You go in and don't have to go some dark, scary corner for the plus-size section. It can make you feel like you're not being {wi}othered{/wi} and dehumanized.

utxt.t: I am a black writer struggling with and through a language that can powerfully evoke and enforce hidden signs of racial superiority, cultural hegemony, and dismissive "{wi}othering{/wi}" of people …

shortdef: to treat or consider (a person or a group of people) as alien to oneself or one's group (as because of different racial, sexual, or cultural characteristics)
